title: Mark my words, Riot has just forced Nasus into the jungle and that’s how they’ll balance him
body:
The +12 buff doesn’t really do a ton for lane Nasus because the dynamic of his lane hasn’t changed: either Nasus was able to farm or he wasn’t. All this buff has done for lane Nasus is make him stomp harder when even against most champions or ahead - which is what he has always done. 

However, I’ve been seeing a lot of high elo streamers playing and complains about how absurd jungle Nasus is right now and that makes sense - theoretically, Nasus can obtain 100 stacks per each clear. As it stands, jungle Nasus is on par with lane Nasus in how quickly he stacks, in some cases jungle Nasus is stacking faster simply because 12 is more than 3. Sure, he’s prone to invades but those aren’t safe and you can take safe clearing paths now, especially if you do vertical jungling. Quite simply, it’s entirely possible that jungle Nasus is too good. 

Why does this concern me? Obviously I am and have been a Nasus main since 2012. I’ve alwaya played him in the top lane and that’s more or less been his goto role baring season 3. Riot literally never reverts stupid changes, they just complicate their situation further by adding on several more stupid changes and inevitably dumpstering a champion until they get across the board buffs or a rework, neither of which Nasus really needs. He was honestly fine before these buffs for what it’s worth. However, now, what Riot will do will likely be taking stacks off his normal rate (go back to 2 instead of 3 like the old days), nerf wither range (again), nerf his ults cooldown or some other totally moronic change that will make him invariably worse and kill him in top lane altogether because of an idiotic change. 

Riot, I don’t know what made you think this was a good idea but please, if you decide its time to nerf Nasus, just revert this stupid change. Don’t try to say “ugh but Nasus jungle is a totally hip and secret strat that has a dedicated following” because that isn’t true. He’s a top lane and that’s how he should be balanced. Please come to your senses and decide that this is the correct change to make (reverting the +12 buff). 

Sincerely yours, 

Someone who is still playing your game after 7 years (a group of people you practically don’t acknowledge anymore).

replies.body: The potential strength of Nasus jungle is definitely on our radar. However, early strength indicators still show top lane as his primary role. We plan to continue balancing him around top.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Wittrock,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1i83Ubbq,comment-id=0017,timestamp=2019-01-13T02:51:24.096+0000)
>
> The potential strength of Nasus jungle is definitely on our radar. However, early strength indicators still show top lane as his primary role. We plan to continue balancing him around top.

Have you considered differing values for Jungle Monsters vs. Large Minions then? The huge bonus for jungle monsters does seem to perhaps over-encourage jungle poaching or jungling -- at least in how it *feels to read the ability*, even if lane Nasus remains the superior option. Due to the relative infrequency of Seige Minions compared to large jungle monsters it *feels* more valuable in the jungle, which is something that might be worth addressing if you want to ensure Nasus reads more as a laning champion.

Unfortunately, I can't think of an especially crisp way to do that short of starting to do specific values for Large Minions vs. Large Monsters, or giving enhanced bonuses for, say, Melee Minions / Caster Minions over monsters.

Agreed, as a jungler I was playing Amumu who struggles a bit early and really needs his gold to scale late game. I had the misfortune of having a Nasus on my team and had my own jungle demolished by my ally. Still won but it was much harder than it should have been, and I'll be honest, I came out of that game feeling worse than I normally do after losses. It was not fun at all.

Maybe if it only stacks on enemy JG minions, or if you have a jungle item, that way as a laner he can hit enemy jungle, but as a jungler he can still hit his own.

By doing this it might also allow them to balance him around Jungle AND top lane at the same time by simply adjusting the stacks per kill.

So in a way he'll be in a similar position to {{champion:32}} in that he'll be viable but difficult to pull off, especially against experienced junglers.

To look at it from another perspective, if Amumu were released as a champion today, the boards would be screaming like banshees about gap closer/snare, two AOE damages AND the Ult AOE with a PERCENTAGE AOE damage spell he can leave on all the time making initiates super easy, high base stats, then icing on the cake the ultimate...Some people might counter with "well he's really vulnerable in the jungle and has mana issues, or once he goes in he can't get out." others would say "he doesn't need to get out if he slaughters everything when he goes in." but ultimately, riot would probably nerf him before players adapted to him. Because he's so well known and players are hyper aware of how to play against him, he currently struggles a lot.

Nasus is in the same position in that regard. I'd even say the play to shut him down will be similar to how people constantly shut amumus down. Both can also be extremely devastating by mid/late game if left alone or ignroed. but that's always been a thing with Nasus, and again, is a thing with other champs as well.

TL;DR He may see a little jungle play this season, but it'll mostly be very early on evolving into a mediocre jungle as opposed to previously non-viable.

Well keep in mind that Nasus is worthless if the whole enemy team is ahead. He's super heavy single target damage. The team falls behind really fast then he can't do anything about it regardless on how he does in lane. He's easy to team up on and shred down, easy to kite out if he doesn't choose you to wither, and if he's behind then it makes all those weaknesses even more apparent. In this day and age where the games are very fast paced, Riot's past two changes to Nasus have been major buffs to speed him up. His ultimate change that decreases the cooldown of his Q and now the +12 change to cannons, large monsters, and champions. If you're a smart player then you'll know to try and hurt him while he tries to go for a cannon to either take out a lot of his health or force him to miss it. If you're jungler is smart, he'll know to get a good early game camp against him to try and keep him down enough for you to gain a lead and for you to able to abuse that lead while you out damage him. There's also the matter of learning to control the flow of the lane by learning how to freeze the waves to make it harder for Nasus to be able to come close to farm without you blowing up his health bar. There are a LOT of champions that can easily abuse a lead on Nasus and keep him down. And as for jungle Nasus you're jungler will have to be an idiot to not counter jungle him because he literally has the weakest early game in the game and his jungle clear is near nonexistent if he wants to take it slow and stack as much as possible.
